#WEBLOGO/ALIGNMENT REPRESENTATION
#In R Markdown page (Rmd file)

```{r}
library(msa)
library(latexpdf)
system.file('tex', 'texshade.sty', package='msa')
```

```{r}
Protein <- read.csv("~/Desktop/XXXX_AlignSeqs.csv")
VectorSIVseq <- Protein$Sequence
names(PROTseq) <- Protein$Name
myAAseqs <- AAStringSet(PROTseq)
myAlignment <- msa(myAAseqs, "ClustalOmega")
```  

```{r}
msaPrettyPrint(myAlignment, output = "pdf", subset=c(1:11), y=c(1,510), showNames = "left", showLogo = "top", logoColors = "rasmol", shadingMode = "similar", showLegend= FALSE, askForOverwrite = FALSE) #VAR#
#Change the 'subset' according to number of sequences and 'y' according to the sequence length
```
